name: Shashankasana (Child's Pose)
procedure: Kneel on the mat with your big toes touching and knees apart.
Sit back on your heels and extend your arms forward.
Lower your forehead to the mat and relax your shoulders.
Hold the position while breathing deeply.
Slowly return to the sitting position.
benefits: Shashankasana provides deep relaxation, relieves back pain, and improves focus by calming the mind.

name: Marjariasana (Cat-Cow Pose)
procedure: Start in a tabletop position with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
Inhale, arch your back, and lift your head (Cow Pose).
Exhale, round your spine, and tuck your chin (Cat Pose).
Repeat for 5-10 breaths in a rhythmic motion.
Return to a neutral spine.
benefits: This asana improves spinal mobility, relieves stress, and strengthens the core.

name: Setu Bandhasana (Bridge Pose)
procedure: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width apart.
Place your arms alongside your body, palms down.
Press your feet into the floor and lift your hips upward.
Hold the pose for 30 seconds while breathing deeply.
Slowly lower your back to the mat.
benefits: This pose helps relieve back pain, strengthens leg muscles, and promotes relaxation.

name: Gomukhasana (Cow Face Pose)
procedure: Sit with legs extended forward.
Cross your right leg over your left and stack your knees.
Reach your right arm behind your back and left arm over your shoulder.
Clasp your hands together and hold for 30 seconds.
Repeat on the other side.
benefits: This pose improves mobility in the shoulders and hips, helping to release built-up tension.

name: Bhujangasana (Cobra Pose)
procedure: Lie on your stomach with hands under shoulders.
Press your palms into the floor and lift your chest.
Keep your elbows slightly bent and shoulders relaxed.
Engage your lower back muscles.
Hold for 15-30 seconds, then release.
benefits: Bhujangasana stretches the spine, opens the lungs, and helps reduce stress and fatigue.

name: Uttanasana (Standing Forward Bend)
procedure: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Exhale and bend forward from the hips.
Keep your knees slightly bent if needed.
Let your hands rest on the ground or grab your ankles.
Hold for 30 seconds, then slowly rise back up.
benefits: This asana enhances flexibility, relieves tension, and promotes relaxation.

name: Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward Dog Pose)
procedure: Start in a tabletop position.
Lift your hips towards the ceiling, straightening your legs.
Press your heels towards the ground and spread your fingers.
Keep your head between your arms.
Hold for 30 seconds, then return to tabletop position.
benefits: This pose helps stretch the spine, improve posture, and boost energy levels.

name: Ardha Matsyendrasana (Half Spinal Twist)
procedure: Sit with legs extended forward.
Bend your right knee and place the right foot outside your left thigh.
Twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow outside your right knee.
Hold for 30 seconds, then switch sides.
Return to a neutral position.
benefits: This twist helps detoxify internal organs, improves spinal flexibility, and enhances digestion.

name: Supta Matsyendrasana (Supine Spinal Twist)
procedure: Lie on your back with legs extended.
Bend your right knee and cross it over your left leg.
Extend your right arm to the side and gaze towards it.
Hold for 30 seconds, then switch sides.
Return to a neutral position.
benefits: This pose relieves back tension, improves spinal flexibility, and aids digestion.

name: Baddha Konasana (Butterfly Pose)
procedure: Sit with your legs extended forward.
Bend your knees and bring your feet together, allowing your knees to drop outward.
Hold your feet with your hands and keep your spine straight.
Gently press your knees downward for a deeper stretch.
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
benefits: Baddha Konasana opens the hips, improves flexibility, and stimulates abdominal organs for better digestion.

name: Ananda Balasana (Happy Baby Pose)
procedure: Lie on your back and bring your knees towards your chest.
Grab the outer edges of your feet with your hands.
Gently pull your knees towards the floor while keeping your back flat.
Rock side to side to massage your spine.
Hold the pose for 30 seconds.
benefits: This pose helps relieve lower back pain, stretches the hips, and promotes relaxation.

name: Malasana (Garland Pose/Squat Pose)
procedure: Stand with feet wider than hip-width apart.
Lower your hips into a squat position.
Bring your palms together in front of your chest.
Press your elbows against your knees to open your hips.
Hold for 30 seconds while keeping your back straight.
benefits: Malasana strengthens the legs, improves hip mobility, and aids digestion.

name: Vrikshasana (Tree Pose)
procedure: Stand tall with your feet together.
Shift your weight to your left leg and place your right foot on your inner thigh or calf.
Bring your palms together in a prayer position at your chest.
Focus on a fixed point for balance.
Hold the pose for 30 seconds, then switch sides.
benefits: This asana helps develop concentration, balance, and strengthens the lower body.

name: Trikonasana (Triangle Pose)
procedure: Stand with your feet wide apart.
Turn your right foot outward and extend your arms parallel to the floor.
Bend sideways towards your right leg and place your right hand on your ankle or the floor.
Stretch your left arm towards the ceiling and gaze at your fingertips.
Hold for 30 seconds, then switch sides.
benefits: Trikonasana improves flexibility, strengthens muscles, and enhances digestion.

name: Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
procedure: Stand tall with feet together and arms by your side.
Engage your core and lengthen your spine.
Raise your arms overhead and stretch upward.
Hold the pose for 30 seconds while breathing deeply.
Slowly lower your arms and relax.
benefits: Tadasana helps with posture, balance, and body awareness.
